summary: Turning time
title: Turning time
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2DCw5J4

by Youngsoul

Post-avengers Endgame (contains spoilers)

A kind of a fix-it fic.

Peter had lost more people he loved than anyone he knew. Just when he thought he’d hit the rock bottom, he would lose again.

The ashes should have felt like victory, but to Peter, they tasted like loss.

He loses… until he decides to get it all back.

Words: 635, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

summary: Do you rememeber the time when we thought the worst thing that could happen to Tony was him losing his left hand because that...
body:
Do you rememeber the time when we thought the worst thing that could happen to Tony was him losing his left hand because that was being teased during the course of all the movies?

We were so naive.

We were truly naive 3000.

reblog.comment:

blog.name: stevesnightmares
blog.title: "Awake, arise, or be forever fallen."
blog.description: “The question that sometimes drives me hazy: Am I or the others crazy?”

summary: Natasha's death: thoughts
body:
Natasha’s death: thoughts

I personally loved Natasha’s death scene but not how her death was treated. I’ll explain.

Natasha’s death was really good because she died for the people that she loved, for those who she called her family. She acted like the hero the she really was, the hero that she worked really hard to became. She never had a family before and she was made to do bad things, but her arc closes with her death, a heroic death, she died doing the right thing, not only to save Clint, the person first that believed in her and trusted her and who decided that instead of killing her he would give her a second change to do good instead, but also for the rest of the people who she calls family, and for the rest of the world, because she wants to save it.

However I hate how Natasha’s death was overshadowed by Tony’s. His death was treated like the most heroic death, he got three of his closest friends/family to talk to him while he was dying, he got a funeral where literally everybody, even people that didn’t really know him or that didn’t really liked him, was there. And what did Natasha get? No one but Clint was there for her when she died, her family mourned her for like 3 seconds, and she didn’t get a burial or a funeral where everybody would mourn her. Why did Tony got the goodbye, the funeral, of a hero and Natasha didn’t? Why couldn’t they Tony’s funeral Tony and Natasha’s funeral?

She acted like an hero, she sacrificed herself for the good of her friends and for the good of the world but she still gets overshadowed by Tony’s death? Fuck that.

(of course I would love for Natasha to be alive, because she deserves the world, but that’s for everyone of the original 6, but if no one had died that would have been really disappointing. However I personally wouldn’t have cared if Bruce had died.)

summary: It's okay to not be okay
title: It's okay to not be okay
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2ZIgtgb

by DolphinsWithHatsTHP

Peter Parker: fourteen years old, living with his last family member alive, May’s brother, starting his first day of high school, about to have a mental breakdown.

Or

Peter is afraid for his first day of high school, he doesn’t want to go, but he knows going is better than staying home, and besides he gets to see his friends. So high school can’t be that bad, right?

summary: We Will Foresee Obstacles
title: We Will Foresee Obstacles
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2ULDgnK

by blackwatchandromeda

Contains ENDGAME SPOILERS!

“So are you gonna save him now?” Morgan asks, voice small.

Peter smiles down at her. “Yeah, Mor. We are.”

-

The war is over. Thanos has been defeated, the population has been restored, and Peter has lost one of the most important people in his life.

After the funeral, Peter meets Harley and Morgan. They’re all in the same position, all missing the same person, and it’s not long before they come up with a scheme to save him.

That is, if they can pull it off.

-

Post-Endgame fix-it fic because I refuse to accept that part. Contains plenty of Ironfam, with a healthy dose of May, Ned and fake time travel science.

Contains ENDGAME SPOILERS!

The war is over. Thanos has been defeated, the population has been restored, and Peter has lost one of the most important people in his life.

After the funeral, Peter meets Harley and Morgan. They’re all in the same position, all missing the same person, and it’s not long before they come up with a scheme to save him.

That is, if they can pull it off.

-

Post-Endgame fix-it fic because I refuse to accept that part. Contains plenty of Ironfam, with a healthy dose of May, Ned and fake time travel science.

summary: Avengers Watch Snippets
title: Avengers Watch Snippets
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2XQUzWv

by Ifihadatardis

As it always happens in these types of fics, it was a normal day when suddenly all of our favorite heroes/villains woke up in a mysterious, inescapable room with only a note to explain why they are there. Oh, and conveniently there’s a bunch of comfy seats and a TV screen, so with no other option, they might as well start watching, right?

AKA Avengers and co watch the film, except not really an entire film, more like snippets of films.

I take requests for what you guys want them to see!

blog.description: This page is full of mixed emotions and other random shit that I'm into... ENJOY!!

summary: endgame = end my suffering
title: endgame = end my suffering
body: its been days since i watched avengers endgame, yet i’m still devastated. At random times during the day, i keep remembering parts of the movie, making me burst out in tears, anger or fits of laughter. This franchise and its characters meant so much to me, i don’t know how to process it.

reblog.comment: its been days since i watched avengers endgame, yet i’m still devastated. At random times during the day, i keep remembering parts of the movie, making me burst out in tears, anger or fits of laughter. This franchise and its characters meant so much to me, i don’t know how to process it.

trail.content_raw: its been days since i watched avengers endgame, yet i’m still devastated. At random times during the day, i keep remembering parts of the movie, making me burst out in tears, anger or fits of laughter. This franchise and its characters meant so much to me, i don’t know how to process it.

At random times during the day, i keep remembering parts of the movie, making me burst out in tears, anger or fits of laughter. This franchise and its characters meant so much to me, i don’t know how to process it.

blog.name: thegirlwhowatchedeverything
blog.title: The Girl Who Watched Everything
blog.description: Sail away with me to another world

summary: Thought I had after seeing Endgame for the third time: I love that Steve’s motivation for going back to Peggy was Tony telling...
body:
Endgame Spoiler!





Thought I had after seeing Endgame for the third time: I love that Steve’s motivation for going back to Peggy was Tony telling him to get a life. Tony always said it jokingly, of course, since his love language was quippy sarcasm and actions (trying to protect the world and his little arc reactor heart since he was the softest Avenger) but he could see how Steve being out of time affected him all those years. These two didn’t always see eye to eye, but Tony was much more perceptive than he let on and many give him credit for. In fact, it was Steve’s perception of Tony that was wrong not vice versa (yes, he says the only thing special about Steve came from a bottle but that was just Tony lashing out in defense). We all know he wasn’t just the guy who would cut the wire, as in use his brain to get out of a sticky situation (which he did in Endgame realizing he only needed to get the stones, not the gauntlet). But my main point is actually about Natasha.

This is my long winded way of saying I wish after Steve told Sam he “got a life like Tony was always talking about” he would have waited a beat then added “the kind I told Nat to get. The kind she should have had.” That would have been nice because Steve and Nat spent so much time together (in Winter Soldier, on the run after Civil War leading to Infinity War, etc) so I would have liked more from Steve on Nat. I know in the epic that was Endgame, concluding 21 other movies he couldn’t wax poetic but this little comment would have been a nice touch. Thanks for coming to my TEDTalk.
